newsitem.title: CHINA: Yuan ends almost unchanged vs dollar in Shanghai.
newsitem.headline: Yuan ends almost unchanged vs dollar in Shanghai.

text.p: The Chinese yuan closed little changed in very slow trading at 8.2908 on Saturday from Friday's 8.2906 against the U.S. dollar with a holiday mood dominating the market, traders said.
The weighted average price on Friday was 8.2908.
The exchange will close from Sunday to Tuesday to mark the Chinese takeover of Hong Kong.
Traders said few people wanted to trade in any serious volume on the last day ahead of the three-day holiday.
The yuan opened at an intraday high of 8.2905 and moved in a very narrow range of 8.2906 and 8.2910 for most of the session, hitting a low of 8.2952. Most business was done at 8.2908, traders said.
One trader said neither buyers nor sellers wanted to push the rate sharply either way due to the forthcoming holiday.
"A small amount of buying emerged at about the 8.2910 level, making the yuan move at a high level," he said.
Dealers said they expected the yuan to move just below the 8.2900 level next Wednesday when the market resumed trading.
The yuan closed up at 7.2331 from 7.2951 against 100 Japanese yen and higher at an intraday high of 1.0690 from 1.0706 against the Hong Kong dollar.
